name: JsonApi

aliases.name: Document
aliases.comment: Data type representing the entire JsonApi document.

aliases.name: ErrorObject
aliases.comment: Data type describing the types of problems that can be encountered when processing a JSON API payload.
aliases.type: { id : Maybe.Maybe String.String, links : Maybe.Maybe JsonApi.Data.ErrorLinks, status : Maybe.Maybe String.String, code : Maybe.Maybe String.String, title : Maybe.Maybe String.String, detail : Maybe.Maybe String.String, source : Maybe.Maybe JsonApi.Data.Source, meta : JsonApi.Meta }

aliases.name: Links
aliases.comment:
Data type representing a JsonApi links object.
See: jsonapi.org/format/#document-links

aliases.name: Meta
aliases.comment:
Data type representing a JsonApi meta object. Alias for Json.Encode.Value.
See: jsonapi.org/format/#document-meta

aliases.name: Resource
aliases.comment: Data type representing a single JsonApi resource.

name: JsonApi.Decode
comment:
Library for decoding JSONAPI-compliant payloads

@docs document, errors

values.name: document
values.comment: Decode a JSONAPI-compliant payload.

values.name: errors
values.comment: Decode the errors returned from a JSON API-compliant server.

name: JsonApi.Documents

values.name: jsonapi
values.comment: Fetch information from the top-level 'jsonapi' object

values.name: links
values.comment: Fetch the top-level links object from the document.

values.name: meta
values.comment: Fetch the top-level meta object from the document.

values.name: primaryResource
values.comment:
Retrieve the primary resource from a decoded Document.
This function assumes a singular primary resource and will return an Err
if the document contains a collection of primary resources.

values.name: primaryResourceCollection
values.comment:
Retrieve a collection of primary resources from a decoded Document.
This function assumes a collection primary resources and will return an Err
if the document contains a singular primary resource.

name: JsonApi.Encode
comment:
Functions for encoding JSON API resources to Json

@docs clientResource

values.name: clientResource
values.comment:
Encode a resource constructed on the client to a JSON API-compliant value
see: <http://jsonapi.org/format/#crud-creating>

name: JsonApi.Resources

values.name: attribute
values.comment:
Serialize a single attributes of a Resource. You must provide the string key of the attribute
and a Json Decoder to convert the attribute into a type that you define.
values.type: String.String -> Json.Decode.Decoder a -> JsonApi.Data.Resource -> Result.Result Json.Decode.Error a

values.name: attributes
values.comment:
Serialize the attributes of a Resource. Because the attributes are unstructured,
you must provide a Json Decoder to convert them into a type that you define.
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder a -> JsonApi.Data.Resource -> Result.Result Json.Decode.Error a

values.name: build
values.comment:
Construct a ClientResource instance with the supplied type.
ClientResources are like Resources but without an 'id' field or related resources.
Use them to represent new Resources that you want to POST to a JSON API server.

values.name: id
values.comment: Get the string ID of a Resource

values.name: links
values.comment: Pull the attributes off of a Resource.

values.name: meta
values.comment: Pull the meta value off of a Resource.

values.name: relatedLinks
values.comment:
Retreive the links from a relationship.
Will return an Err if the relationship does not exist.

values.name: relatedMeta
values.comment:
Retreive the meta information from a relationship.
Will return an Err if the relationship does not exist.

values.name: relatedResource
values.comment:
Find a related resource.
Will return an Err if a resource collection is found.

values.name: relatedResourceCollection
values.comment:
Find a related collection of resources.
Will return an Err if a single resource is found.

values.name: withAttributes
values.comment: Add a list of string-value pairs as attributes to a ClientResource

values.name: withRelationship
values.comment: Add a relationship with a single related resource to a ClientResource

values.name: withRelationships
values.comment: Add a relationship with a collection of related resources to a ClientResource

values.name: withUuid
values.comment:
Add a client-generated UUID to the resource. MUST be a valid Uuid in the
canonical representation xxxxxxxx-xxxx-Axxx-Yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx where A is
the version number between [1-5] and Y is in the range [8-B].

    I recommend using http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/danyx23/elm-uuid/2.0.2/Uuid
    to general a valid UUID.
